citeinfo.title: Hydrofeature
citeinfo.othercit:
This dataset was developed through project number 1051 supervised by the City of Baltimore DPW. Planimetric data was captured to American Society of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS) Class I Accuracy Standards for 1"= 40' scale maps for area within the City and for the outfall alignment and Back River Wastewater treatment plant and to ASPRS Class I Accuracy standards for 1"=100' scale maps with 2' contours for the LochRaven reservoir. Planimetric / topographic data based on 2008 aerial photography. Note that selected areas involved the production of 1' contours (Patapsaco Wastewater Treatment Plan) and the outfall alignment.
Project 831 (2/2001 - 6/2003) involved update and new planimetric and topographic mapping.

descript.abstract:
This dataset represents photogrammetrically captured hydrography including hidden hydrography used to provide continuous topology. Feature capture rules:
Waterbodies (lakes, ponds, harbors) - Compile all ponds and lakes, including stormwater drainage ponds > ¼ acre as waterbodies. Does not include swamps or wetlands unless completely interspersed with water. Areas not visible shall be identified as hidden.
Waterways (Streams, ditches) - Compile all stream, ditches, rivers, and harbors > 5' in width as waterways. Both banks of the stream shall be digitized and formed into a polygon. Areas not visible shall be identified as hidden.
Reservoirs - Compile all reservoirs > ¼ acre as reservoirs. Areas not visible shall be identified as hidden. Includes area of reservoir being embanked.
descript.purpose: This data was created as a landbase feature as part of the planimetric data.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

dataqual.logic: This data was tested for validity, physical and logical consistency and general cleanliness.
dataqual.complete: All features included in the database design that were visible on the Spring 2008 aerial photography were captured and validated against the orthoimagery for completeness.

citeinfo.origin: City of Baltimore Department of Public Works, Bureau of Water and Wastewater

procstep.procdesc:
Planimetric and topographic features were compiled from aerial photography using softcopy photogrammetric workstations.
Features were updated from prior photogrammetric base map and new features were compiled. All features were reviewed and updated on a per stereomodel basis. Change detection was completed by reviewing older planimetric data in comparison with the updated orthoimagery. This was used to focus the updates. All data was delivered in ESRI geodatabase format using an updated and enhanced data base design. Prior to performing the updates data was migrated from the existing geodatabase structure into the new format. Exception reports were produced and data was modified to adhere to the new design. The migrated data was provided to Sanborn for updating. It was translated into a format compatiable with ZI imaging workstations. Updates were performed and data was then translated to ESRI geodatabase format. Custom validation reports were developed and run using ESRI?s PLTS for quality control. Data was QCed using the orthoimagery as a backdrop. Based on the QC process edits were performed. After final acceptance all data was appended into a seamless geodatabase. The following features were included in the update process.
Paved Rd Curb Cut Paved Driveway Paved Alley Paved and Unpaved Median Paved Parking All road centerline ( Ex. Paved and Unpaved roads, paved alleys, bridges and tunnels) Building, >100 SF Hydrography (Streams, ditches, lakes, ponds, harbors) Railroad (Heavy, light, and subway) Tunnel (road, rail, and pedestrain) Bridge (road, rail, and pedestraian) Hydrographic centreline (streams and ditches improved and unimproved as visible, approx 5' wide- incl. "hidden" through "culverts" for full connectivity Retaining Wall (including portals and abutements Wooded/Brush areas- as defined by canopy Hydrographic Structures (piers, bulkheads, sea walls) Headwall/Ednwall Structures Dam" footprint: (including spillway) Bank improvements (riprap, gabion, paved) Storage Tanks, silos and water towers Power plants and substations Structures under constrution or demolition(ruins) evident by visible foundation or walls Areas of distrubance (construction sites without visible foundation or walls Street light base (include type if visible in photo) Traffic Signal (signal head only - no directionality wires, or poles) Traffic signal pole base (poles associated with and or use in support of Traffic Signal Heads) Screening/noise wall Party Walls
